intro: Pteropyrum olivieri var. gracile, commonly known as the slender thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Americas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and slender, hairy stems. Its leaves are usually finely divided and have a mild, sometimes spicy scent. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks.
